DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Agent Course Rate Or Total Dose Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total dose or rate of administration of a protocol agent over a course of protocol therapy. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Agent Course Rate Or Total Dose
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol._A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention._A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The amount of drug administered to a patient or test subject at one time or the total quantity administered. [AMA Manual of Style] (CDISC Glossary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredDefinition: A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI):Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of drug administered to a patient or test subject at one time or the total quantity administered. [AMA Manual of Style] (CDISC Glossary)_A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Surgery (Immunotherapy) legacy data migration
